block.p: Susan Kathleen Fallon, a daughter of Vice Adm. William J. Fallon and Mrs. Fallon of Norfolk, Va., was married yesterday to Christopher Lindsay Mattingly, a son of Patricia Aiken-O'Neill of Washington and Francis H. Mattingly of Staunton, Va. Msgr. Thomas M. Duffy performed the ceremony at the Dahlgren Chapel of the Sacred Heart in Washington.

Ms. Fallon, 29, is keeping her name. She is the vice president for communications at Community of Science Inc., an Internet company based in Baltimore that offers research and development professionals information, goods and services. She graduated from the University of Virginia.

Susan Kathleen Fallon, a daughter of Vice Adm. William J. Fallon and Mrs. Fallon of Norfolk, Va., was married yesterday to Christopher Lindsay Mattingly, a son of Patricia Aiken-O'Neill of Washington and Francis H. Mattingly of Staunton, Va. Msgr. Thomas M. Duffy performed the ceremony at the Dahlgren Chapel of the Sacred Heart in Washington.

Ms. Fallon, 29, is keeping her name. She is the vice president for communications at Community of Science Inc., an Internet company based in Baltimore that offers research and development professionals information, goods and services. She graduated from the University of Virginia.

The bride's father is the commander of the Second Fleet, which is based at Norfolk, where he is also the commander of the Atlantic region for the NATO Striking Fleet. Her mother, Mary E. Fallon, is a member of the executive board of the Tidewater Officers Spouses' Club, which is also in Norfolk.

Mr. Mattingly, 32, is based in Arlington, Va., where he is writing and producing a documentary film about the Silk Route and trans-Asian trade. He graduated from the University of Arizona at Tucson and received a master's degree in film production from American University.

The bridegroom's mother is the president of the Eye Bank Association of America, an organ transplant organization and lobbying group in Washington. His father is the proprietor of the Sampson-Eagon Inn, a bed and breakfast in Staunton, which he runs with the bridegroom's stepmother, Laura M. Mattingly. The bridegroom's stepfather, Dr. John F. O'Neill, is a pediatric ophthalmologist in Washington.
The bridegroom's grandfather the late Brig. Gen. Thomas W. Mattingly was the personal cardiologist to President Dwight D. Eisenhower.
